citation.article-title: Amycolatopsis helveola sp. nov. and Amycolatopsis pigmentata sp. nov., isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Amycolatopsis helveola sp. nov.
Amycolatopsis helveola (hel.ve′o.la. L. fem. adj. helveola pale yellow).
Vegetative hyphae are finely branched and fragmentation is not observed.
Sporophores show monopodial or dichotomous branching.
The spore chain is arranged in a hook, flexuous, loop or retinaculiaperti manner.
The spores (0.8–1.5 μm in diameter) are spherical, oval or rod-shaped.
They have a smooth surface and are non-motile.
Pale yellow colour colonies are formed.
Good growth occurs between 20 °C and 37 °C; no growth occurs at NaCl concentrations higher than 5 % (w/v).

The following compounds are utilized as sole carbon sources: d-adonitol, d-arabitol, erythritol, d-fructose, N-acetylglucosamine, d-glucose, d-lyxose, d-mannose, d-melibiose, d-ribose, d-sucrose and d-trehalose.

However, the following compounds are not utilized as carbon sources: amygdalin, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, l-arabitol, arbutin, d-cellobiose, dulcitol, aesculin, ferric citrate, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, glycogen, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, inositol, inulin, d-lactose, d-maltose, d-mannitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, d-melezitose, d-raffinose, salicin, d-sorbitol, l-sorbose, starch, d-tagatose, d-turanose, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, d-xylose or l-xylose.
Positive for acid phosphatase, esterase, esterase lipase, leucine arylamidase and phosphohydrolase.

Negative for nitrate reduction, alkaline phosphatase, chymotrypsin, cystine arylamidase, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase, lipase, pyrazinamidase, trypsin and valine arylamidase.
Aesculin, gelatin and urea are not hydrolysed.
The major cellular fatty acids are iso-C16 : 0 and 2-OH-iso-C16 : 0.
The type strain, TT00-43T (=NBRC 103394T=KCTC 19329T), was isolated from a forest soil sample from Amami Oshima Island, Japan.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain is 68.9 mol%.
